block.p: Susan Leigh Sherrill and Frederick Canavan were married yesterday by the Rev. John Hartnett at St. Elizabeth's Episcopal Church in Ridgewood, N.J. The bride's father, the Rev. Christopher R. Sherrill, who is the associate rector at Trinity Church in Princeton, N.J., assisted in the ceremony.

The bride, 39, is the managing editor, in Franklin Lakes, N.J., for BCN Media, a publisher of seven community newspapers. Until January, she was the chef and owner of the Village Green Cafe, a restaurant in Ridgewood. She graduated from Trinity College in Hartford. Her mother, Leigh Sherrill, and father live in Princeton. The bride's mother, now retired, was a program analyst for the Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

Susan Leigh Sherrill and Frederick Canavan were married yesterday by the Rev. John Hartnett at St. Elizabeth's Episcopal Church in Ridgewood, N.J. The bride's father, the Rev. Christopher R. Sherrill, who is the associate rector at Trinity Church in Princeton, N.J., assisted in the ceremony.

The bride, 39, is the managing editor, in Franklin Lakes, N.J., for BCN Media, a publisher of seven community newspapers. Until January, she was the chef and owner of the Village Green Cafe, a restaurant in Ridgewood. She graduated from Trinity College in Hartford. Her mother, Leigh Sherrill, and father live in Princeton. The bride's mother, now retired, was a program analyst for the Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

The bridegroom, 44, has a construction management business in Midland Park, N.J. He is a son of Cira and Peter Canavan of Clifton, N.J. The bridegroom's father, who is retired, was the chief financial officer of Walter Kidde Inc., a manufacturer of fire protection equipment that was in Wake Forest, N.C.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bridegroom's.
